intro: Tabernaemontana glaucescens, commonly known as the blue milk tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens with suitable conditions.
